html:
2025-0666
2025-09-18AAFC, HCHealth of Animals Act
Safe Food for Canadians ActRegulations Amending the Health of Animals Regulations and the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (Reducing Red Tape and Supporting Resilience - Import Reference Document, Hatcheries and Fresh Fruits and Vegetables)Regulations Amending the Health of Animals Regulations and the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (Reducing Red Tape and Supporting Resilience - Import Reference Document, Hatcheries and Fresh Fruits and Vegetables) in order to (1) incorporate the Import Reference Document (IRD) into the Health of Animals Regulations (HAR) on an ambulatory basis; (2) update import conditions for veal in the IRD to increase flexibility for veal producers; (3) update import conditions in the IRD to require Salmonella Enteritidis testing for hatching eggs imported from U.S. to align with domestic requirements; (4) reduce the prescriptiveness of traceability labelling requirements for hatching eggs and chicks leaving a hatchery; (5) remove prescriptive labelling requirements for fresh fruit and vegetables (FFV); and (6) modernize Canada’s approach to FFV grades by transferring certain grades to industry and removing mandatory grades for FFV to be processed.Registration: SOR/2025-0192 Publication Date: 2025-10-08
act:
Health of Animals Act
Safe Food for Canadians Act
subject: Regulations Amending the Health of Animals Regulations and the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (Reducing Red Tape and Supporting Resilience - Import Reference Document, Hatcheries and Fresh Fruits and Vegetables)
precis: Regulations Amending the Health of Animals Regulations and the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (Reducing Red Tape and Supporting Resilience - Import Reference Document, Hatcheries and Fresh Fruits and Vegetables) in order to (1) incorporate the Import Reference Document (IRD) into the Health of Animals Regulations (HAR) on an ambulatory basis; (2) update import conditions for veal in the IRD to increase flexibility for veal producers; (3) update import conditions in the IRD to require Salmonella Enteritidis testing for hatching eggs imported from U.S. to align with domestic requirements; (4) reduce the prescriptiveness of traceability labelling requirements for hatching eggs and chicks leaving a hatchery; (5) remove prescriptive labelling requirements for fresh fruit and vegetables (FFV); and (6) modernize Canada’s approach to FFV grades by transferring certain grades to industry and removing mandatory grades for FFV to be processed.
